defaultPosition.companyName: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) - Department of Homeland Security
defaultPosition.description:
- Create and write Joint Terrorism Task Force (JTTF) subject reports for National Security in coordination with both HSI and FBI Special Agents assigned to the JTTF to support counterterrorism investigations, including culling A-file information.
- Co-founded HSI NSID NSU Emergency Surge Team, allowing for expanded reporting during National terrorist attack response.
- Assisted on stablished an SOP for the National Security Unit's Counterterrorism Section and implemented the procedures during additional on-boarding.
- Assist with training for team members and new employees on DHS systems, serving as senior analyst.
- Communicate with interagency to facilitate ongoing investigations and creation of JTTF reports.
- Coordinate with HSI National Security Law Section on resolution of National Security questions regarding subjects, legal US status, and immigration law.
- Input data into FALCON and conducted link analysis won subjects.
- Considered Subject Matter Expert (SME) for DHS entity systems to include: TECS, AFI, ADIS, ATS-P/L, CLEAR, EARM, EAGLE, CCD, HSIN, SEVIS, PCQS, USVISIT.
defaultPosition.title: Management and Program Analyst

positions.companyName: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) - Department of Homeland Security
positions.description:
- Create and write Joint Terrorism Task Force (JTTF) subject reports for National Security in coordination with both HSI and FBI Special Agents assigned to the JTTF to support counterterrorism investigations, including culling A-file information.

positions.title: Management and Program Analyst

positions.description:
Research, analyze and evaluate Biometric information pertaining to nonimmigrants overstay vilolators. To provide data for law enforcement and national security agencies and organizations seeking related data.
Able to analyze, identify trends, manage stakeholders request in numerous U.S. government information systems. 
- Collected data from a wide variety of data base software, both DOS-based and web-based VISA overstays. Including: SEVIS, CCD, ADIS, and TECS.
- Participated in special projects, new and upcoming database software.
positions.title: Management and Program Analyst

positions.description:
Work as noncommision officer for the S-4 Batallion Logistic section. Assisted the Logistics officer in the planning and execution of the batallion logistics. Perform clerical duties and daily task during overseas deployment.
Batallion S-3 Training Staff Noncommision Officer in charge. Assist in the developement and planning of training evolutions for more than 100 Marines, Officers, and Sailors. Also in charge of supervising and conducting training, gathering/collecting information and scores of training and in putting data into the several military systems.
positions.title: Infantry, Non-Commission Officer

positions.description: Performed duties as a team member, Team Leader and Squad Leader. Planned and executed training evolutions ranging from class setting environment to live shooting exersices. Able to maintaing good group cohesion and moral always working as a group.
positions.title: Private First Class - Non Commission Officer
